general_requirements.border_notification: All weapons, parts of weapons, ammunition and parts of ammunition must be declared to the customs office on importation, exportation and transit.

illegal.description: Completely prohibited weapons that cannot be imported, exported, or possessed

items.description: Automatic firearms and automatic firearms converted to semiautomatic small arms
Daggers, throwing knives, butterfly knives, switchblade knives and other knives with automatic release mechanism or a spring assisted opening mechanism
Beating weapons, throwing weapons and slings
Weapons disguised as everyday objects (e.g. walking stick or camera)
Silencers and laser and night-vision devices

permit_or_registration.description: Weapons requiring permits, notifications, or special conditions

items.description: Pistols, revolvers, rifles, pump action guns, lever action guns, self-loading guns (shotguns and rifles)
items.conditions: Permit required for carrying in public and border crossing

items.description: Compressed air and CO2 weapons that develop a muzzle energy of at least 7.5 joules or that can be mistaken for real firearms
Imitation, blank cartridge and airsoft weapons that can be mistaken for real firearms due to their appearance
Knives whose blade can be opened by automatic mechanism (one hand), overall length > 12 cm and blade > 5 cm
Daggers with a symmetrical blade no longer than 30 cm
Knuckledusters, simple or spring batons, throwing stars and slingshots with arm support
Spray devices with irritants (CA, CS, CN or CR) according to Appendix 2 Weapons Ordinance
Personal war weapons with corresponding ammunition for shooting competitions or training
items.conditions: Competition or training purposes only, no permit required but evidence needed

legal.description: Weapons allowed under specific conditions with tax exemptions

items.description: Single- or multi-barrel firearms with smooth-bore barrels (shotguns) or rifled barrels (hunting carbines and harquebuses), combination guns
items.conditions: Up to 2 personal hunting weapons with ammunition for temporary import/export
benefits: No permit required for temporary import/export

items.description: Small arms of all calibers (e.g. target shooting pistols) clearly recognizable as target weapons
items.conditions: Up to 2 personal target weapons or 1 hunting + 1 target weapon with ammunition
benefits: No permit required for temporary import/export

items.description: Standard pepper sprays (not containing CA, CS, CN or CR irritants)
items.conditions: Excluded from electric shock device and irritant spray restrictions

important_notes.ammunition_restrictions: Ammunition acquired abroad by residents of Switzerland requires a permit in all cases and is exempt from tax only up to the allowance of CHF 150
important_notes.supporting_evidence: Includes shooting programmes, invitations to events, hunting permits and hunting ground leases
important_notes.general_permit_rule: Weapons which are not classified as prohibited require a permit
important_notes.carrying_permit: A permit is required for carrying a weapon in public
important_notes.border_crossing: A permit is required for importing, exporting or transiting weapons, parts of weapons, ammunition and parts of ammunition
